intro: Bupleurum qinghaiense, commonly known as Qinghai angelica, is a perennial herb native to the Qinghai Plateau in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. The roots of Bupleurum qinghaiense are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
